subject: Re: [junit] Erroneous Failure
msgSnippet: ... Nevermind, the TestCase was inadvertantly declared in an abstract class. -- They that give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety
messageBody:
Berin Loritsch wrote:
> I have a TestCase that I have not yet put the assert() statements in, and when I
> run the TestCase, I am seeing:
>
> Running org.apache.avalon.excalibur.system.test.ContainerProfile
> Tests run: 1, Failures: 1, Errors: 0, Time elapsed: 0.021 sec
> TEST org.apache.avalon.excalibur.system.test.ContainerProfile FAILED
>
> Usually, when an exception is thrown, I see the result as an ERROR,
> with an associated StackTrace. This is a mystery to me.
>
> Has anyone run into this?
>
> How can a Test fail if there are no assertion violations or exceptions
> thrown?


Nevermind, the TestCase was inadvertantly declared in an abstract class.




--

"They that give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety
deserve neither liberty nor safety."
- Benjamin Franklin
